item.title: Hugo Markdown language reference
item.description: CSS syntax highlight (GitHub-Flavored) Markdown Editor Basic useful feature list: Ctrl+S / Cmd+S to save the file Ctrl+Shift+S / Cmd+Shift+S to choose to save as Markdown or HTML Drag and drop a file into here to load it File contents are saved in the URL so you can share files I’m no good at writing sample / filler text, so go write something yourself. item.title: Clear content of multiple files at once
item.description: When I am updating my linux template, I sometimes like to delete all old logs, as first step I delete old rotated logs, check how are your log rotated and create a find like this one: # Assuming my rotates logs format is : messages.2017-09-15.log find /var/log/ -name ‘.20.log’ -delete The command above will delete all file that match the rule, you can limit how deep you want to find files using maxdepth.

item.title: OSSEC - log rotation
item.description: When SELinux enabled, some OSSEC packages will fail to rotate logs under /var/ossec/logs, which will result in crontab errors and in some cases failure to write to logs. One way to fix this is to change context type, for this let’s first check the current context: # Check the current SELinux context: ls -aZ /var/ossec/logs # Change SELinux context: semanage fcontext -a -t var_log_t "/var/ossec/logs(/.*)?" # Apply the previous context change: restorecon -R -v /var/ossec/logs # Check/confirm the context change: ls -aZ /var/ossec/logs Command explanation: semanage fcontext : Used to change SELinux context of files.
